entry.title: Nginx and $_SERVER['HTTPS']
entry.content:
When you are using the FastCGI Php version, you would set HTTPS variable if you are serving parts of you website with SSL. To do that, add the following function into the http section of your nginx configuration map $scheme $fastcgi_https { ## Detect when HTTPS is used default off; https on; } and use the variable into your server section fastcgi_param HTTPS $fastcgi_https;

Lazy explanation as usual :P

entry.title: upstream sent too big header while reading response header from upstream
entry.content:
if you have this error from nginx with php-fpm and output_buffers = On in your php.ini then try to increment the buffer size in nginx:
```

fastcgi_buffers 8 16k;
fastcgi_buffer_size 32k;
```
